results.definition: strip of feathers
examples: pull a chicken

results.definition: a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
examples: he was sidelined with a hamstring pull

results.definition: perform an act, usually with a negative connotation
examples: pull a bank robbery

results.definition: remove, usually with some force or effort; also used in an abstract sense
examples: pull weeds

results.definition: special advantage or influence
examples: the chairman's nephew has a lot of pull

results.definition: direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
examples: The ad pulled in many potential customers
This pianist pulls huge crowds

results.definition: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
examples: pull out a gun
The mugger pulled a knife on his victim

results.definition: a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke)
take sides with; align oneself with; show strong sympathy for
examples: I'm pulling for the underdog

results.definition: tear or be torn violently
examples: pull the cooked chicken into strips

results.definition: cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
examples: A declining dollar pulled down the export figures for the last quarter

results.definition: the act of pulling; applying force to move something toward or with you
examples: the pull up the hill had him breathing harder
his strenuous pulling strained his back

results.definition: cause to move by pulling
examples: pull a sled

results.definition: strain abnormally
examples: I pulled a muscle in my leg when I jumped up
The athlete pulled a tendon in the competition

results.definition: a device used for pulling something
examples: he grabbed the pull and opened the drawer

results.definition: apply force so as to cause motion towards the source of the motion
examples: pull the string gently
pull the trigger of the gun
pull your knees towards your chin

results.definition: a sustained effort
examples: it was a long pull but we made it

results.definition: hit in the direction that the player is facing when carrying through the swing
examples: pull the ball

results.definition: move into a certain direction
examples: the car pulls to the right

results.definition: operate when rowing a boat
examples: pull the oars

results.definition: rein in to keep from winning a race
examples: pull a horse

results.definition: steer into a certain direction
examples: pull one's horse to a stand

results.definition: take away
examples: pull the old soup cans from the supermarket shelf

results.definition: the force used in pulling
examples: the pull of the moon
the pull of the current
